Title: Omega Seamaster Automatic 2577-14SC - Bumpwind 351 w/ Arrow Marker Dial ca. 1952
Description: 34.5x42.5mm (not counting the crown) OMEGA SEAMASTER AUTOMATIC 2577-14 SC ca. 1952. Early bumper wind Omega automatic in gold cap over s/s screw back case. Five times signed- original dial, case, movement, crown and signed Omega buckle on the dark green genuine lizard strap. Good running signed Omega caliber 351 bumper wind automatic with 17J. Serial number 13xxxxxx dates the watch to 1952. Two-tone original silver dial has raised gold arrow and arabic markers, gold sword hands and sweep seconds. The case is that early and cool beefy design with thick claw lugs. Original signed lug nut crown. Good running order, my watchmaker just time regulated and inspected the movement. These are not just a cool watch to wear but they go up in value as an investment piece, too.
